website_summaries.verdict: It's no flagship, but the Microsoft Lumia 640 XL LTE offers a solid big-screen experience at a budget price point that's hard to beat.
pros: The Microsoft Lumia 640 XL LTE has a bright 5.7-inch screen, works on LTE networks, and has an impressive rear camera and long-lasting battery life
cons: The 720p resolution makes for a lower pixel density than you may want
The processor is a little under-specced for power-users, and the plastic casing can't match the premium feel of some phones

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone the Windows 8 UI is great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a broken Note 3. I love this phone the Windows 8 UI is great. The lack of apps is a bit disappointing, but for email, text messaging, web browsing, and calls it works flawlessly. Way more stable than my Note on Lollipop. Popped in a straight talk ATT sim card and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Laurence

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic phone. Just as described. Delivery was super fast. Just that the package has no usb cable. Strange. Actually writing this review with the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phone performs great even with its mid to low end specs
customer_reviews.text: Phone performs great even with its mid to low end specs. The screen is great. Sharp and bright with nice viewing angles. The only thing that might bother some people is the UI isn't the smoothest. It is still very livable without skipping many frames. It doesn't bother me at all. Overall, awesome phone for the price. Worked right away with my t- mobile sim card.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Bozzo

customer_reviews.title: For all Windows users
customer_reviews.text: Love my phone. Almost 2 years later and it still works as if it was brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Felicity R.

customer_reviews.title: Came from iPhone 6
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone alot! It is much better than apple. Used to be a big apple fan boy but decided to try it out and it is absolutely amazing! I would recommend this phone over an IPhone any day. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the back cover (white) came broken by the volume rocker
customer_reviews.author: Blake webb

customer_reviews.title: i luv it
customer_reviews.text: I luv this phone. It's a bright orange. Easy to understand after you figure out how to change everything to English. It take some beautiful pics.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Ray

customer_reviews.title: This is a good phone, it does everything I need and does ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good phone, it does everything I need and does it well. I am coming over from iPhone 6 and the 640xl is a lot more pleasing experience. I don't see what people see in ios, windows is better smoother and well laid out. The 640xl is very practical you get a pretty good phone for a decent price. If you want top notch everything then wait for the upcoming 940xl, the 640 is everything I need in a phone. Great battery life. Big screen. Light weight. Nice OS.
customer_reviews.author: richmoe

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone. I'm using it with AT&T and T-Mobile sim cards. I installed the sim cards before the initial boot and it recognized the right away. Windows phones do not have the available number of apps like Android and Apple but I am really pleased with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: TB1993

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and Good phone that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alain

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Excellent device!! Just waiting the upgrade for W10 sw version. Great screen, good specs. Office and Outlook functions just great. Cons: A little slow when running Candy Crush and wireless charging a wish!
customer_reviews.author: Renzo

customer_reviews.title: phone screen expands and crunchy cracks after five months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Phone worked very well and looked great for the first five months, until one day i was on the phone talking and the phone screen began to expand and crunchy crack all over the screen and dust glass particles busting out. I was scared kt was going to explode. This is very disappointing. It is very dangerous. I have heard of phones exploding. The phone did not fall and wasn't on charge. Just by it self. I have submitted a claim for a new one or my money back and am waiting fir their response.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL

customer_reviews.title: Great phone works great
customer_reviews.text: Great phone works great. Just wish window 10 was on it or that att would update already. Windows store needs much improvement. But works great for the things I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Bret O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Lumia XL LteDual Sim
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Microsoft Lumia phone. The XL is so much easier to read and I love the Dual Sim. This way I don't need another cell phone when travelling to Germany. The only drawback I see is that the android phones have so many more apps available. I miss playing Scrabble on the Microsoft phone, a great way to pass the time at airports or in doctor's offices. I do like the fact that the Microsoft phone was much more affordable than the Android phones I was considering. All in all I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Reisetante

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: feel little too big for my hands....but, tech-wise, always trust windows-phone!! thank you.
customer_reviews.author: SHIGERU

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great phone!! Nice features worth buying it, am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carline Jeudy

customer_reviews.title: All the good things said in the reviews are generally true
customer_reviews.text: All the good things said in the reviews are generally true, nice screen, fast enough, etc. But after a month my earphone stopped working. Calls on speaker or with earbuds connected are fine, but no sound from the earphone. This appears to be a common problem as reported on Microsoft support site and might be attributed to loose screws at top of phone from taking off back cover. Also a possible software bug. Either way, it is unsatisfactory to have an almost new phone have it's earphone stop working for no apparent reason.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barnett

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU ARE TECH SAVVY. BAD CHOICE.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst phone I have ever had. Bad facebook app. No snap chat bad cellular choice over sensitive screen I am very disappointed in this phone. I'd rather have a iPhone than this damn thing. Great camera not enough space can't delete contacts that synced from facebook puts my contacts backwards doesn't update apps appa barely download and still have a problem using them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They have no good apps. The interface is klunky
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking of getting a Windows phone. Don't. They have no good apps. The interface is klunky. It doesn't even phone well, and that is like it's main job. The radio feature was super cool, but not enough to make up for the os. Just go get an Android or iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Adam T.

customer_reviews.title: No LTE in US RM-1096 ATT
customer_reviews.text: Great Phone, nice screen but it doesn't pickup LTE in US - ATT. I even called ATT and they really didn't offer any help. Looks like the only thing it will give is 4G. Thinking about returning the product only purchased because the details listed this model as being compatible with LTE in US Model No. 640XL, Dual Sim, RM-1096. However, if the phone picked up LTE I would have given the phone 4 stars at least.
customer_reviews.author: Mikki

customer_reviews.title: Check with seller first.
customer_reviews.text: If you want the 1 year free Office 360 Personal be sure to ask the seller what the model number is and if it is a valid device to receive the offer. I bought one offered by a seller here and after downloading the 360 Gift app found out from the app that was an invalid model and was not offered. I bought 2 already returned one and on the verge of sending the other back as well. Shame though this is one boss of a mid level phone. Have used it steadily for 1 day 7 hours and still have 33% battery left. Only giving 2 stars due to the missing Office 360 feature.
customer_reviews.author: Alien

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Forward Compatible, Windows Phone
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my wife to replace a Nokia Lumina 710. The larger screen is great, you can fit many more tiles on the main screen, viewing pictures and video is much more usable and the 12MP camera takes some really nice pictures. It's also Windows 10 upgrade compatible, (comes with 8.1) so has longevity. I'm still using an HTC Radar and I'm very jealous - may need to buy another. Considering the cost of the latest phones on the market, this phone is a bargain and does everything those "newer" phones can. If you love the Windows Phone OS, this is a great upgrade option at a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone!
customer_reviews.text: If you like synchronization this phone is awesome! Everything is connected! My outlook and emails, calendar, one drive, office, photos... Best phone and I love the living pictures function. I previously had a Nokia Lumia 925 which I was in love with, but it was time to upgrade my camera. Go Microsoft! I am a groupie.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: A good Backup Phone
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect upgrade from my Lumia 1320.It is a shame the Windows Phone/Mobile isn't around anymore this this phone still is amazing everytime I pick it up
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good, Not Great, Windows 10 Phone
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a HTC Pro7, Lumia 920, Lumia 640, and a Lumia 950XL. All of them are solid phones. The only drawback with the 640XL is the 1 GB of RAM...which is even too small to run the Facebook app. I've always liked the mobile browser version of Facebook, so it's not so bad. Could be better, though.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Still learning my way around the phone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Still learning my way around the phone. Easy to use. Switching info from my old phone was done at Microsoft store without a hitch. Large screen is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: clyde mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The phone works wonderful the only problem was the cord got very hot and had to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Finewine

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: best value on the market right now. Of course, its Microsoft and all that, but apart of a few apps that I miss (Garmin Connect, Paybyphone), the phone is great. Note: you can buy 4 of these phones for 1 iphone...
customer_reviews.author: Peter M

customer_reviews.title: In love with this phone!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I went with this over the 1520! No problems at all getting it set up on Straight Talk. The only reason its not getting 5 stars is because the charger and instruction booklet were Chinese. Fortunately my old phone charger worked and my Google-fu is strong. It did come a few days earlier than expected though, so that would be worth an extra half a star if I could give it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The Lumia 640XL is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: It took me three years to upgrade my HTC 8x to the Lumia 640XL. The decision to go with the 640XL has been a very good one. The phone works fine. Added to my account at T-Mobile without a hitch. Still learning all the features and increased capability. I do wish more companies would get of their duff and provide a Windows app. Particularly, Banks, Medical services, financial houses, retail stores, and many others. I think they are just too lazy. To those who say get IOS or Android phone I would say, why should I get a lower performing phone?
customer_reviews.author: Pakeha

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to order Like New, but it turned out awesome, original packaging, phone has no defects. Works great, so easy to start up and add all my contacts with my Microsoft account. I did add all my photos to Onedrive app so I wouldn't lose them, that worked out great. I love the big screen, don't have to put my reading glasses on everytime the phone went off. Shipping was fast with great packaging. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Should Be Your Next Phone
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased for my wife. She loves it especially the larger 5.7" screen compared to her previous version, the Lumia 920. Like the 920 it is a Microsoft Windows platform which we both love compared to the iPhones we quit using several years ago. The Lumia product features and performance are excellent across their line of phones.
customer_reviews.author: DonJ

customer_reviews.title: amazing mobile
customer_reviews.text: I love it, not very big, have a nice features, but the comment is on the price is high and i found outside cheaper by 60$, it's LTE 4G, and working fine with me in Saudi Arabia and Egypt also, really this phone is amazing, but still need win 10 to be unbelievable, I really loved it :), and I think if it's 2 GB ram it'll be better
customer_reviews.author: Sameh Saeed

customer_reviews.title: don't like it at all
customer_reviews.text: cheap phone, at least it works and does what is needed, has windows 8.1, never upgraded to 10, so shame on Microsoft, Win OS for phones really, really, really ........ I assume that is why Nokia is out of the market now
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Leon Madrigal

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Lumia 1520, which I had dropped. Compared to the 1520, this is a much more cheaply constructed camera, with a simple plastic case. The only major negatives from an operational standpoint are the lack of 5GHz wifi and the dedicated camera button on other Lumia cameras. However, considering the price differential, I am very happy with this camera. (As other buyers have noted, this is a Chinese market phone, so it boots into a Chinese language screen until your SIM card (in my case from AT&T) is recognized.
customer_reviews.author: detroitMI

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device. Would receive 5 stars if had at least 16 Gb of memory.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Unless you know Chinese
customer_reviews.text: Amazon apparently picks and chooses the comments at their convenience because I was requested to resubmit. This product although ok was received with Chinese as default and to compound the problem it came locked without providing a code. I would think twice because what I received was not what I read, instruction-wise. Was I mislead? Hummmmm
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Microsoft Lumia 640 XL 8GB White Dual Sim (RM-1096) Unlocked International Model- No Warranty
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteDimensions 157.9 x 81.5 x 9 mm (6.22 x 3.21 x 0.35 in) Weight 171 g (6.03 oz) SIM Dual SIM (Micro-SIM, dual stand-by) DISPLAY Type IPS LCD capacitive touchscreen, 16M colors Size 5.7 inches (~69.1% screen-to-body ratio) Resolution 720 x 1280 pixels (~259 ppi pixel density) Multitouch Yes Protection Corning Gorilla Glass 3 - ClearBlack display PLATFORM OS Microsoft Windows Phone 8.1 with Lumia Denim Chipset Qualcomm MSM8226 Snapdragon 400 CPU Quad-core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 GPU Adreno 305 MEMORY Card slot microSD, up to 128 GB Internal 8 GB, 1 GB RAM CAMERA Primary 13 MP, 4128 x 3096 pixels, Carl Zeiss optics, autofocus, LED flash Features 1/3'' sensor size Video 1080p@30fps Secondary 5 MP, 1080p SOUND Alert types Vibration; MP3, WAV ringtones Loudspeaker Yes 3.5mm jack Yes COMMS WLAN Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, DLNA, hotspot Bluetooth v4.0, A2DP GPS Yes, with A-GPS, GLONASS, Beidou NFC Yes Radio FM radio USB microUSB v2.0 FEATURES Sensors Accelerometer, proximity, compass, sensor core Messaging SMS (threaded view), MMS, Email, Push Email, IM Browser HTML5 Java No - MP3/WAV/eAAC /WMA player - MP4/H.264/WMV player - OneDrive (30 GB cloud storage) - Document viewer - Photo/video editor BATTERY Li-Ion 3000 mAh battery Stand-by Up to 936 h (2G) / Up to 936 h (3G) Talk time Up to 31 h 20 min (2G) / Up to 23 h 40 min (3G) MISC Colors Matte cyan, Orange, Black, Matte white, Glossy white Price group About 270 EURLow cost shipping in both Canada and the US and free local pickup available.New in open package. Guaranteed to work.Supported frequency bands: 3G WCDMA: 1,2,4,5,8 - 4G LTE: 1,2,3,4,5,7,8,12,17,20,28,30,40,41
feature_bullets: RM-1096. New, DUAL SIM, Unlocked, International GSM model. Will work with GSM networks like AT&T and T-mobile. Will not work with CDMA networks like Verizon or Sprint.
This cell phone may not include a US warranty as some manufacturers do not honor warranties for international version phones. Please contact the seller for specific warranty information.
This item may contain a foreign charger. If so, a FREE US adapter will be provided.
